did.unittitle:
W. B. Pillsbury pamphlets and reprints
1900-1950
did.abstract: Pillsbury was professor of psychology at the University of Michigan from 1897 to 1942; collection consists of reprints of articles an book reviews.

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: The collection was assembled forma variety of sources.

accruals.p: No further additions to the records are expected.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open to research.

userestrict.p: The copyright status of individual pamphlets is unclear.

prefercite.p: [item], folder, box, W. B. Pillsbury pamphlets and reprints, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: Walter Bowers Pillsbury was professor of psychology at the University of Michigan, teaching first in the philosophy department and then helping to establish a psychology department. Pillsbury was born July 21, 1872 in Burlington, Iowa. He studied at Penn College, the University of Nebraska, and Cornell University where he received his Ph. D. degree in 1896. After teaching for a year at Cornell, Pillsbury in 1897 came to the University of Michigan as an instructor in psychology (in the philosophy department). In 1901, he became director of the psychology laboratory. In 1910, he was made full professor and in 1929, when the department of psychology was established, he was appointed chairman.

Before coming to the university, there were only occasional lectures in psychology, given by philosophy professors. Pillsbury introduced regular courses in psychology. He also established the psychological laboratory which introduced students to laboratory work and stimulated extensive experimentation with humans as well as animals. In his research and writing, Pillsbury was renowned for his work in the area of reasoning and attention, publishing monographs on both topics. He was skilled as a teacher and lecturer, and was a prolific writer. Pillsbury retired from the university in 1942 and died in 1960.

scopecontent.p: The Walter Pillsbury pamphlets and reprints collection consists of articles and book review on various topics in psychology, including articles about contemporary psychologists Edouard Claparede , Harvey A. Carr, James McKeen Cattell, John Dewey, Joseph Jastrow, and Clarence Stone Yoakum

did.unittitle: Pamphlets and Reprints.
An attempt to harmonize the current psychological theories of the judgment. 1907
Attention. undated
Attention: a reply. 1909
Attention waves as a means of measuring fatigue. 1903
Body form and introversion-extroversion. 1939
A case of mental conflict. 1936
Clarence Stone Yoakum. 1879-1945.
The common points in recent theories of problem solving. 1939
The concept in psychology. undated
Correlations between the university-grades of parents and children and of siblings. 1939
Does the sensation of movement originate in the joint? 1901
Edouard Claparede. 1873-1940.
The ego and empirical psychology. 1907
An extension of the Kohler-Restorff inhibition phenomenon. 1943.
Gestalt vs. concept as a principle of explanation in psychology. 1926
Harvey A. Carr: 1873-1954. 1955
James McKeen Cattell 1860-1944. 1947
Joseph Jastrow 1863-1944. 1944
Knowledge in modern psychology. 1950
Margaret Floy Washburn (1871-1939). 1940
The new developments in psychology in the past quarter century. 1917
A new form of piston recorder and some of the changes of the volume of the finger which it records. 1899
A note on 'advancing and retreating' colors. 1937
The place of movement in consciousness. 1911
Propaganda and the democratic state. 1943
The psychological nature of casualty. 1904
The psychology of Edward Bradford Titchener. 1928
Recent naturalistic theories of reasoning. 1924
Retroactive and proactive inhibition in immediate memory. 1940
The role of the type in simple mental processes. 1911
Secondary rhythms of the normal human heart. 1899
Selection--an unnoticed function of education. 1921
A study in apperception. 1897
A suggestion toward reinterpretation of Introspection. 1904
Suggestions for a compromise of existing controversies in psychology. 1922
Titchener and James. 1943
Trial and error as a factor in evolution. 1906
The units of experience--meaning or gestalt. 1933
What is native in the so-called instincts? 1927
Book Reviews
"How We Learn" by Boyd H. Bode (book review) from American Journal of Psychology, 1941
"Psychologie der Veranderungsauffassung" by Von L. Wilhelm Stern (book review) from The Critical Review, 1900

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: W. B. Pillsbury papers, 1890-1942 (3.5 linear feet) are held by the Bentley Historical Library. Walter
